div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Feb. 10, 1922. FROM THE LABOR FRONT

body.p: Many specialized workers have found employment in the Stockyards and it is evident that the officials have sent for them. Because of this the strikers having a difficult time . Many are turned away, although they have work.

Lodge No. 80, of the Alliance, has delegated a committee to make a collection for the needy strikers in and S. Stuczgnski, who were elected collectors, made a good showing in their early efforts. Over 123.50 was collected from various business men individuals in .

The following unemployed workers have received assistance: S. Kokoszka, Kordula, , $15, Chojnacki, $15, J. Krawczyk, $10; S. Mazurkiewicz, $10; 1. Pierczynski, $10; S. Mrawczykowski, $15; and J. Kozierski, $15.
